intro: Senecio schwetzowii, commonly known as the Schwetzow's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a cluster at the end of its stems. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, with a rough texture. It is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads.
